com.fujitsu.xml.xpointer.processor
Class XPointerProcessor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.fujitsu.xml.xpointer.processor.XPointerProcessor
public class XPointerProcessor
extends java.lang.Object

Class that provides an XPointer processor.
The XPointer processor provides a function that analyzes a fragment identifier in accordance with an XPointer definition.

Constructor Summary

          Constructor.

setProperties

public void setProperties(XLinkProperties properties)
Properties are obtained.
Parameters:
properties - Properties.
If null is set, XPointerProcessor uses default values.

retrieve

public LocationSet retrieve(java.lang.String xptr,
                            Document doc,
                            Node originNode,
                            Node hereNode)
                     throws XPointerException
A fragment identifier is analyzed as an XPointer to search for corresponding location information.
A location set is returned as the analysis result.
If the specified fragment identifier is incorrect as an XPointer character string, an exception occurs.
Parameters:
xptr - Fragment identifier.
doc - Search target document node.
originNode - Element from which a user or program initiated traversal of the link.
hereNode - Element with an XPointer character string written in the document.
Returns:
The location set holding the search result is returned.
Throws:
XPointerException - If the specified fragment identifier is incorrect as an XPointer character string or the specified argument except originNode and hereNode is null.

retrieveNodes

public NodeSet retrieveNodes(java.lang.String xptr,
                             Document doc,
                             Node originNode,
                             Node hereNode)
                      throws XPointerException
A fragment identifier is analyzed as an XPointer to search for a corresponding node.
A node set is returned as the analysis result.
If the specified fragment identifier is incorrect as an XPointer character string, an exception occurs.
Parameters:
xptr - Fragment identifier.
doc - Search target document node.
originNode - Element from which a user or program initiated traversal of the link.
hereNode - Element with an XPointer character string written in the document.
Returns:
The node set holding the search result is returned.
Throws:
XPointerException - If the specified fragment identifier is incorrect as an XPointer character string or the specified argument except originNode and hereNode is null.

retrieveFirstNode

public Node retrieveFirstNode(java.lang.String xptr,
                              Document doc,
                              Node originNode,
                              Node hereNode)
                       throws XPointerException
A fragment identifier is analyzed as an XPointer to search for a corresponding node.
If two or more nodes are obtained as the search result, the first node in the document is returned.
Parameters:
xptr - Fragment identifier.
doc - Search target document node.
originNode - Element from which a user or program initiated traversal of the link.
hereNode - Element with an XPointer character string written in the document.
Returns:
The node obtained as the search result is returned.
Throws:
XPointerException - If the specified fragment identifier is incorrect as an XPointer character string or the specified argument except originNode and hereNode is null
